value.0:
By Royal Decree
Queen-Monarch Zaranda Star Rhindaun, and the Monarch's Privy Council have decreed that any Tethyrian Citizen granted Knighthood shall have the following duties, responsibilities and benefits:
 
A Knight shall always defend the Crown and her interests as the heart of his conviction.
A Knight shall challenge those who attempt to defame the integrity of Tethyr, her name or her ruler to honorable combat.
A Knight shall never refuse a challenge of his honor from an equal and always protect the honor of his fellow Knights.
A Knight shall refrain from unnecessary or extreme acts of violence except in the case of defending the honor of Tethyr or her citizens.
A Knight shall maintain a high moral standard, setting the bar for both the noble and lower classes for righteous and just behavior.
A Knight shall follow and enforce all laws and decrees brought forth by the Crown. This shall include the appropriate Temporal or Ecclesiastical authority he may find himself within the jurisdiction of; furthermore, he shall be subject to their laws and all punishments implied therein.
A Knight shall never break an oath once given.
 
A Knight shall receive a stipend from the Crown, in addition to any other stipend he receives from his liege lord.
A Knight is entitled to the stated rewards or bounties of wanted criminals or any other declared beasts outlined in a endorsed Royal Decree.
A Knight shall always receive shelter and sanctuary should he seek it from any local authority. In addition, they shall equip him if he should find himself without weapon, armor or steed.
A Knight of great renown who proves financial ability may beseech the local Temporal or Ecclesiastical authority to bestow upon him a fortress and a standing body of warriors. His duties to the Crown increase considerably and he shall be granted the rank of Lord-Knight.
A Knight whose honor was never broken shall be forever honored with a traditional Tethyrian funeral as well as in the Hall of Heroes.

Rules of Engagement and Fair Dueling for Honorable Combat:
- A Duelist may not be assisted by any third party.
- Vestments from the Gods are permitted.
- Arcane enchantments or trickery are strictly prohibited.
- Should a Duelist yield to their better, the match will have ended in forfeit. 
  It is proper to grant mercy to a yielding opponent.	

1. Duelists must agree to the terms of the match 
   - The nature of the contest
   - To the death, first blood, to the pain, et cetera

2. An agreement upon the date or time of the match must be reached.
   - A duel may be postponed by injury or a conflicting duty.

3. Duelists must be separated by at least five arm lengths before the commencement of a match.

4. A victor shall be declared when the agreed upon terms of the match have been met.
